intro: Chusua chrysea, commonly known as the golden chusua, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
